text:
Would someone be able to explain what this code is doing:

```
	sockp, err := net.Listen("tcp", viper.GetString("server.port"))

	server = grpc.NewServer(opts...)

	aca.Start(server)
	eca.Start(server)
	tca.Start(server)
	tlsca.Start(server)

	server.Serve(sockp)
```

From looking at the docs, would I be correct in thinking it's opening up a listener on some port, starting a grpc server and attaching the CA services to this server and then binding the GRPC server to the listener?

Another quick question, this `crypto.Peer` struct we find in fabric: <https://godoc.org/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/crypto>

What is it used for - as in when it says " Peer is an entity able to verify transactions" what does that entail exactly?

<@U0KPFAZNF> <@U0PB67X4K>  I was just able to build docker images as well as peer binary on mac, and successfully ran chaincode deploy and invoke against a network started in docker for mac. that’s not by accident right? I mean this is so awesome!
